Description: Mummy of an adult cat (hind legs pushed up against the pelvis and the forelegs drawn down the body; skeleton appears to be complete with no signs of trauma; soft tissue present); the wrappings, consisting of narrow strips of linen of light and dark brown, have been skillfully arranged so as to form a repeating lozenge pattern; the facial features have been modelled with applied buttons of coarse linen for the eyes, the corners of the mouth have been internally padded to give a raised appearance, mouth and whiskers are further represented by linen threads and the eyes and mouth have been emphasized with brown paint.
Curator's comments: Published: T. Phillips [ed.], Africa, London 1995, p. 102 [1.69a] = T. Phillips [ed.], Afrika, Berlin 1996, p.102 [1.69a].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son of Luxor's Sands 1990 24 Mar-10 Jun, Australia, Canberra, National Gallery of Australia, Civilization: Ancient Treasures from the British Museum, cat. no.50 1990 28 Jun-23 Sep, Australia, Melbourne, Museum of Victoria, Civilization: Ancient Treasures from the British Museum, cat. no.50 1994 Jan-Mar, Doncaster Museum & Art Gallery, Ancient Egypt 1995/6 Oct-Jan, Royal Academy of Arts, Africa: The Art of a Continent 1996 Mar-May, Berlin, Martin Gropius Bau, Africa: The Art of a Continent 1996 May-Sep, New York, Guggenheim Museum, Africa: The Art of a Continent
